semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Resistant Hypertension with Additional Code Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Diseases of the Circulatory System > a. Hypertension > 12) Hypertension, Resistant

content.full_text: Resistant hypertension refers to blood pressure of a patient with hypertension that remains above goal in spite of the use of antihypertensive medications. Assign code I1A.0, Resistant hypertension, as an additional code when apparent treatment resistant hypertension, treatment resistant hypertension, or true resistant hypertension is documented by the provider. A code for the specific type of existing hypertension is sequenced first, if known. (Evidence: pg no: 52, L47-L49)
